repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Jumbo is the yearbook of the undergraduate colleges of Tufts University. It has been published annually since 1916, though the the title "The Jumbo" was first used for the 1917 edition. Over the years it has been known alternately as the Jumbo Book or simply Jumbo. In later years the yearbooks are often untitled.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The yearbook of Tufts University, undergraduate arts and sciences. The Jumbo replaced the Brown and Blue, which ceased publication in 1904. The first Jumbo Book was published in 1917, though a 1916 yearbook titled simply, "Tufts 1916" also exists. Other books were published in 1922, 1925, and 1928. The Jumbo has been continuously published since 1928. This collection also contains one issue of Taps from 1920 and Elephas from 1921, which functioned as a yearbook.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is processed and open for research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains copies of the annual Jumbo beginning in 1917, as well as a Tufts yearbook from 1916 (not officially titled "The Jumbo," but in the same tradition.) The Jumbo appeared only sporadically at first, in 1922, 1925, and 1928, and thereafter appeared annually. Starting in 2012 it was published as the Senior Memory Book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The yearbook of Tufts University, undergraduate arts and sciences. The Jumbo replaced the Brown and Blue, which ceased publication in 1904. The first Jumbo Book was published in 1917. Other books were published in 1922, 1925, and 1928. The Jumbo has been continuously published since 1928.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Caption: The Third Day Vocal Ensemble was founded 3 years ago by black students who felt a need for a choir to sing and share with the campus different types of Black American Music. Each year, Third Day participates in Kwanza, sings at neighborhood churches and participates in Protestant services as Goddard Chapel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the first yearbook to be released at Tufts after Brown and Blue ceased publication in 1904. It is not officially called "The Jumbo," but it represents an attempt "to furnish a graduating class with a memento of the Hill in word and picture." This yearbook was moved from the MacJannet collection (see note in MS024.001.142.00007).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No Reading Room copy. This publication does not officially hold "The Jumbo" title. The front plate of this yearbook reads: "This is the first attempt since 1904 to furnish a graduating class with a memento of the 'Hill' in word and picture. Bearing in mind the results of former and more elaborate ventures of this nature, we have aimed to eliminate all but the most interesting material." This yearbook was originally removed from the MacJannet collection (see note in MS024.001.142.00007).
